oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tribute to the Country Music Hall of Fame Reel #1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Tex Ritter (host) introducing Country Music Hall of Fame members: Jimmie Rodgers (musician), Roy Acuff (musician), George D. Hay (radio personality), Ernest Tubb (musician), Jim Denny (music publisher), Eddy Arnold (musician), Dave Macon (musician), A. P. Carter (musician) and the Carters (musical group), Hank Williams (musician), and Art Satherley (recording executive). The musician members listed are succeeded by performances. The tape was produced by Ralph Emery in WSM Radio Studios. The reel was issued February 09, 1968.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tex Ritter; Jimmie Rodgers; Roy Acuff; Ernest Tubb; Jim Denny; Eddy Arnold; Dave Macon; A. P. Carter; Hank Williams; Art Satherley
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Tex Ritter reflects on the life of Jimmie Rodgers atop of an unidentified tune -- (00:53) Gambling Bar Room Blues (Jimmie Rodgers) -- (04:15) Ritter discusses "The Smokey Mountain Boy" Roy Acuff atop an unidentified tune -- (05:05) The Wabash Cannonball (Roy Acuff) -- (07:41) Ritter introduces "The Solemn Old Judge" George D. Hay atop an unidentified tune -- (08:38) A sound clip is played introducing the Grand Ole Opry -- (08:55) Ritter introduces "The Texas Troubadour" Ernest Tubb atop an unidentified tune -- (09:50) Walking the Floor Over You (Ernest Tubb) -- (11:55) Ritter introduces Jim Denny atop an unidentified tune -- (12:51) Ritter introduces Eddy Arnold atop an unidentified tune -- (13:40) Anytime (Eddy Arnold) -- (15:53) Ritter introduces Uncle Dave Macon atop an unidentified tune-- (17:06) Railroadin' and Gamblin' (Clawhammer Banjo) (Uncle Dave Macon) -- (19:49) Ritter introduces A. P. Carter and the Carters atop an unidentified tune -- (20:48) Wildwood Flower (Carter Family) -- (23:56) Ritter introduces Hank Williams atop an unidentified tune-- (24:45) Long Gone Lonesome Blues (Hank Williams) -- (27:34) Ritter introduces reflects on Art Satherley's folk art work atop an unidentified tune
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ritter, Tex; Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974; Rodgers, Jimmie, 1897-1933; Rodgers, Jimmie, 1933-; Acuff, Roy; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Carter, A. P. (Alvin Pleasant), 1891-1960; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953. I saw the light; Satherley, Art;
